snippet: Lawmakers and some of their aides could be subject to variables based on age, place of residence and tobacco use in health exchanges.
abstract: Obama administration says the government will continue contributing to the cost of health benefits for lawmakers and thousands of Congressional employees, but that they will have to buy coverage as individuals through new state-based markets known as insurance exchanges.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers and some of their aides could be subject to variables based on age, place of residence and tobacco use in health exchanges.

headline.main: Higher Costs Seen for Some in Congress on Health Plans
headline.print_headline: Higher Cost Of Health Plan Seen for Some In Congress

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
